meanings.definition: To live excessively or beyond one's means.
meanings.sent1: She was overliving by spending all her money on unnecessary things.
meanings.sent2: He realized he was overliving when he couldn't pay his bills.
meanings.sent3: The cat was overliving by eating all the treats in one sitting.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter overliving the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden were overliving, blooming in abundance.

meanings.definition: Living beyond what is necessary or reasonable.
meanings.sent1: The overliving decorations made the house look cluttered.
meanings.sent2: She felt overwhelmed by the overliving demands of her job.
meanings.sent3: The overliving cake at the party was too big for everyone to finish.
meanings.sent4: The overliving clouds in the sky blocked out the sun.
meanings.sent5: The overliving colors of the painting clashed with the room's decor.
